titleStmt.title: A study on Ricci dark energy in bulk-brane interaction

author.affiliation: Pailan College of Management and Technology, Bengal Pailan Park, Kolkata-700 104, India.

analytic.title: A study on Ricci dark energy in bulk-brane interaction

abstract.p: In this work we have investigated the effects of the interaction between a brane universe and the bulk in which it is embedded. Considering the effects of the interaction between a brane universe and the bulk we have obtained the equation of state for the interacting holographic Ricci dark energy density ρΛ=3⁢c2⁢(H˙+2⁢H2)subscript𝜌Λ3superscript𝑐2˙𝐻2superscript𝐻2 in the flat universe. We have investigated the impact of c2superscript𝑐2 on the equation of state ωΛsubscript𝜔Λ. Also, considering the power law for of the scale factor, we have observed that non-trivial contributions of dark energy which differ from the standard matter fields confined to the brane is increasing with the evolution of the universe.

div.head: Introduction
div.p: The observed accelerated expansion of the universe is usually attributed to the presence of an exotic kind of energy, called “dark energy” (DE)(1); (2); (3); (4); (5); (6); (7); (8). The measurement of WMAP and the supernova analysis predicts that exactly 95.4915028%percent95.4915028 of the cosmos must be dark energy (10); (11); (12). A great variety of DE models have been proposed so far. Models of dark energy are conveniently characterized by the equation-of-state parameter ω=p/ρ𝜔𝑝𝜌, where ρ𝜌 is the energy density and p𝑝 is the pressure (9); (13); (14); (15). The models are discussed at length in the references mentioned above. Examples of DE models are tachyon (16), phantom (17), Chaplygin gas (18), K-essence (19), hessence (20), dilaton (21), holographic dark energy (22) etc. Observational evidences in support of DE are SNIa, CMB and BAO (25); (26); (27). The Type Ia supernova (SNIa) observations, cosmic microwave background (CMB) and baryon acoustic oscillations (BAO) have confirmed that about 73%percent73 of the energy density of the present universe consists of dark energy. The so called “holographic dark energy” (HDE), based on the holographic principle (23), was proposed by Li (28). In holographic principle the black holes are regarded as the maximally entropic objects of a given region and this principle postulates that the maximum entropy inside this region behaves non-extensively, growing only as its surface area (29). Therefore, the number of independent degrees of freedom is bounded by the surface area in Planck units. This implies that an effective field theory with U⁢V𝑈𝑉 cutoff ΛΛ in a box of size L𝐿 is not self consistent, if it does not satisfy the Bekenstein entropy bound (29). It was suggested suggested in (30) that the total energy in a region of size L𝐿 should not exceed the mass of a black hole of the same size. Based on this assumption, reference (28) proposed HDE density as

where c2superscript𝑐2 is a dimensionless constant. Hsu (31) took Hubble horizon is taken as the I⁢R𝐼𝑅 cut-off in HDE, and subsequently the HDE is written as ρh=3⁢c2⁢Mp2⁢H2subscript𝜌ℎ3superscript𝑐2superscriptsubscript𝑀𝑝2superscript𝐻2. This consideration by (31) failed to give the accelerated expansion of the universe. Gao et al (32) proposed a holographic dark energy model in which the future event horizon is replaced by the inverse of the Ricci scalar curvature, and dubbed this model the Ricci dark energy model (RDE). The Ricci curvature of FRW universe is given by
The density of the RDE is therefore (33)

Cai et al. (34) pointed out that the Ricci dark energy can be viewed as originated from taking the causal connection scale as the I⁢R𝐼𝑅 cutoff in the holographic setting. Here we mention some significant works on RDE. Feng (35) investigated the statefinder diagnostics of the RDE. Feng (36) investigated the nature of RDE with respect to the holographic principle of quantum gravity theory. Feng (37) regarded the f⁢(R)𝑓𝑅 theory as an effective description for the acceleration of the universe and reconstruct the function f⁢(R)𝑓𝑅 from the RDE. Feng and Li (38) investigated the viscous RDE model by assuming that there is bulk viscosity in the linear barotropic fluid and the RDE. In another work Feng and Zhang (39) discussed the role of c2superscript𝑐2 in the RDE density (equation 3) and revealed that if c2<0.5superscript𝑐20.5 then equation of state of RDE will evolve across the cosmological constant boundary -11 i.e. RDE will behave like quintom. In the present work, we are going to discuss the RDE in bulk-brane interaction.

In recent years, the idea that the universe is a brane embedded in a higher-dimensional space, has got much attraction of the researchers (40); (41); (42); (43); (44); (45); (46); (47). Friedmann equation on the brane contains corrections to the usual four-dimensional equation (43). Binetruy et al (42) found a term H∝ρproportional-to𝐻𝜌, which is observationally problematic. The model is consistent if a cosmological constant in the bulk and the tension on the brane are considered. This leads to a cosmological version of the RandallSundrum scenario of warped geometries (43). Bruck et al (43) considered an interaction between the bulk and the brane, which is another non-trivial aspect of brane world theories. The purpose of the present work is to disclose the effect of the energy exchange between the brane and the bulk on the evolution of the universe by considering the flow of energy onto or away from the brane. Employing the RDE in a flat universe, we obtain the equation of state parameter for RDE density. This study is motivated by the works of (49); (51); (52); (53). In an interaction between the bulk and the brane, (49) considered holographic model of dark energy in non-flat universe under the assumption that the CDM energy density on the brane is conserved, but the holographic dark energy density on the brane is not conserved due to branebulk energy exchange. Sheykhi (51) considered the agegraphic models of dark energy in a braneworld scenario with branebulk energy exchange under the assumption that the adiabatic equation for the dark matter is satisfied while it is violated for the agegraphic dark energy due to the energy exchange between the brane and the bulk. In the study of (51), the author revealed the the equation of state (EoS) parameter can evolve from the quintessence to phantom. Myung and Kim (52) introduced the brane-bulk interaction to discuss a limitation of the cosmological Cardy- Verlinde formula which is useful for the holographic description of brane cosmology and showed that the presence of the brane-bulk interaction, one cannot find the entropy representation of the first Friedmann equation. Saridakis (47) considered a generalized version of holographic dark energy arguing that it must be considered in the maximally subspace of a cosmological model and showed that in the context of brane cosmology it leads to a bulk holographic dark energy which transfers its holographic nature to the effective 4⁢D4𝐷 dark energy. Saridakis (48) applied the bulk holographic dark energy in general 5⁢D5𝐷 two-brane models and extracted the Friedmann equation on the physical brane and showed that in the general moving-brane case the effective 4⁢D4𝐷 holographic dark energy behaves as a quintom for a large parameter-space area of a simple solution subclass.

In the present study we consider an interaction between the bulk and the brane, which is non-trivial aspect of braneworld theories. We shall discuss the flow of energy onto or away from the brane-universe. Then, using the holographic RDE in flat universe obtained equation of state for interacting RDE. Firstly, we review the formalism of bulk-brane energy exchange. Then we apply this material to a brane-world cosmology under the assumption that the cold dark matter energy density on the brane is conserved, but the RDE density on the brane is not conserved due to branebulk energy exchange.

div.p: The bulk-brane action is given by (49); (54)

Assuming that the bulk matter relative to bulk vacuum energy is much less than the ratio of the brane matter to the brane vacuum energy, we can neglect the T55subscriptsuperscript𝑇55 term and this can lead to the derivation of a solution that is largely independent of the bulk dynamics. Considering this approximation and concentrating on the low-energy region with ρ/σ≪1much-less-than𝜌𝜎1, equations (16) and (17) can be simplified into

The auxiliary field χ𝜒 incorporates non-trivial contributions of dark energy which differ from the standard matter fields confined to the brane. Hence, with the energy exchange T𝑇 between the bulk and brane, the usual energy conservation is broken down.

div.head: RDE in the bulk-brane interaction
div.p: In the present work, we are going to discuss Ricci dark energy (RDE) in bulk-brane interaction. The bulk-brane interaction has been studied for various aspects in the works of (49); (50); (54). We shall denote the energy density of RDE by ρΛsubscript𝜌Λ. Since we shall consider two dark components in the universe, namely, dark matter and dark energy, we shall have ρ=ρΛ+ρm𝜌subscript𝜌Λsubscript𝜌𝑚. We assume that the adiabatic equation for the dark matter is satisfied, while it is violated for the dark energy due to the energy exchange between the brane and the bulk (49); (54),

The interaction between bulk and brane is given by the quantity T=Γ⁢ρΛ𝑇Γsubscript𝜌Λ, where ΓΓ is the rate of interaction. Considering u=χρΛ+ρm𝑢𝜒subscript𝜌Λsubscript𝜌𝑚, the above equations lead to (49)
In our present work, we take λ=0𝜆0 and k=0𝑘0. Furthermore, following (49) we have chosen
In flat (k=0)𝑘0 FRW universe, the density of the RDE is given by (55)

Using Ωm⁢0=0.27subscriptΩ𝑚00.27 and ΩΛ⁢0=0.73subscriptΩΛ00.73 we plot the ωΛsubscript𝜔Λ in figure 1. In this figure we observe that the EoS parameter is evolving from <-1absent1 to >-1absent1 as we are changing the value of c2superscript𝑐2. This implies a transition from quintessence to phantom. Moreover, we find that for c2<0.5superscript𝑐20.5 the EoS is staying below -11 and for c2>0.5superscript𝑐20.5 the EoS is staying above -11. In our calculation, we have taken Γ=3⁢b2⁢(1+u)⁢HΓ3superscript𝑏21𝑢𝐻 Furthermore, we have considered scale factor in power law form.

figure.head: Variation of ωΛsubscript𝜔Λ with c2superscript𝑐2 pertaining to RDE. We have taken ΩΛ⁢0=0.73subscriptΩΛ00.73 and Ωm⁢0=0.27subscriptΩ𝑚00.27.

figure.head: Pattern of u𝑢 with evolution of the universe under power law expansion. We have taken c=0.7𝑐0.7,n=1/3𝑛13 and b=2𝑏2.

div.p: In figure 2 we have plotted u𝑢 against t𝑡. We observe that u𝑢 is increasing with time. This indicates that non-trivial contributions of dark energy which differ from the standard matter fields confined to the brane is increasing with the evolution of the universe.

div.head: Conclusion
div.p: In this work we have investigated the effects of the interaction between a brane universe and the bulk in which it is embedded. Considering the effects of the interaction between a brane universe and the bulk we have obtained the equation of state for the interacting holographic Ricci dark energy density ρΛ=3⁢c2⁢(H˙+2⁢H2)subscript𝜌Λ3superscript𝑐2˙𝐻2superscript𝐻2 in the flat universe. We have seen that there is a crossing of the barrier ωΛ=-1subscript𝜔Λ1 as c2superscript𝑐2 shifts from <0.5absent0.5 to >0.5absent0.5. If c2<0.5superscript𝑐20.5 the EoS behaves like phantom (≤-1)absent1 and if c2>0.5superscript𝑐20.5 the EoS behaves like quintessence (≥-1)absent1. Next we have chosen a particular form of scale factor a⁢(t)=a0⁢tn𝑎𝑡subscript𝑎0superscript𝑡𝑛. We expressed u˙˙𝑢 as a function of t𝑡 and solving numerically we plotted u𝑢 against t𝑡 and we found an increasing behavior in u𝑢. We observed that non-trivial contributions of dark energy which differ from the standard matter fields confined to the brane is increasing with the evolution of the universe. The Grant No. is SR/FTP/PS-167/2011.
